messages.message:
<!here> Hi all, pre-submit checks are getting better!

Here’s the first pass at this: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/9624

What does this mean for you right now?
  1. Make sure pre-commit is installed in your repo (brew install pre-commit && pre-commit install)
  1. pip install gitpython==2.1.11
    - You’ll need to make sure that gitpython is available in all of your tabs. Reason is: when you run “git commit”, it run Instabase specific checks which require the “gitpython” library
  2. cd into the toplevel instabase directory, then run “make init”
       - make init in the “instabase” top level directory sets up the correct git pre-submit hooks
   3.  More pre-submit checks are coming! Specifically we’re speeding up the Python build so that .proto gen doesn’t take as long

Please make requests for what other pre-submit checks you’d like to see by adding a text and a comment to this doc! https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D2-mLTV91kU6rrfn7Jzm3RgEnv6SSDEjBzCAyEMqjiE/edit

@Aaron Vontell @Jessica I know there are some frontend pre-submit checks you want, like “ensure that make build-prod” was run before committing

Can show you how to set that up using our pre-submit checks
Is there a reason why we build and push front end code instead of push and then build?
For instance, we never push our python build files
(But yes that pre commit build would be great as well)

Nope, we totally should push, and then build the JS on our build machines

If you’re up for changing our Javascript build system that’d be awesome and I could show you some pointers about how to do it!

There’s a lot of copy-foo that you’ll have to make sure continues to work
